title: Clean up a bit now that lifetimes are non-lexical.
body:
I was doing some performance work and some of these clone() calls appear in
profiles. There's more to do but I'd rather take out the low hanging fruit first
:)

title: Bump smallvec to 1.0, release new minor version (0.27.2)
body: r? @SimonSapin

title: Add support for attributes on match arms in match_ignore_ascii_case!
Fix using the `match_ignore_ascii_case` macro inside another macro expansion
Remove use of procedural-masquerade
body: It’s unnecessary since Rust 1.30

title: Work around warning from `late_bound_lifetime_arguments` lint
body:
The generic parsing functions require lifetime annotations to build because of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/42508. 

However, this creates a warning from the `late_bound_lifetime_arguments` compatibility lint, described in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/42868, because they have both early-bound and late-bound lifetime parameters.

This PR works around this warning, in a functional but sub-optimal way. The result is quite verbose, and I didn't manage to "convince" rustc to think all lifetimes were early-bound at the `fn` definitions, but manages to avoid triggering both https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/42508 and the lint, by passing these closures via variables at each call-site.

Fixes https://github.com/servo/rust-cssparser/issues/254

title: Unconditionally use MaybeUninit
body: This raises the minimum Rust version to 1.36.0, so this is a breaking change.

title: Expose byte index in tokenizer's position.
body: I need it to finish my implementation of Properties and Values syntax. It works on bytes rather than CSS tokens, but it calls the consume a name algorithm, for which I'm using cssparser. However I need to know how much of the input was actually consumed after consuming a name to continue the parse. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/servo/rust-cssparser/249)
